Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed 4 of 4 employee records reviewed lacked a statement signed by the employee acknowledging having read the operation Policies and Procedures.
Correction Narrative: All employees at In His Hands have now read and signed acknowledgement of reading and understanding the policies and procedures at this operation.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's medication record did not include the reason for prescribing the medication.
Upon review of 2 employees files it was found that both employees completed the required TB test after their start date with the operation.
Correction Narrative: Administrator is now aware of the TB tests need to be completed prior to staff being around children.  Their personnel files have been updated, and IHH will do better moving forward with TB testing.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, we observed 4 of 4 job descriptions that lacked documentation of position-required qualifications.
Correction Narrative: Candice Roberts, administrator, has updated all job descriptions to include Position-required qualifications.  See document library for new descriptions added.

Deficiency Narrative: No assessments or evaluations were given to the worker when the child was discharged.
Correction Narrative: The form reviewed was completed, and new guidelines were entered into a new form for the operation to complete each time a child is discharged.  This will be in effect moving forward.  See document library.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was injured at school and taken to er the following day with a fracture.  This should have been called into SWI
Correction Narrative: An overall Serious Incident Reporting form was compiled and reviewed with staff - all incidents requiring a SWI report were reviewed and questions were taken. See document library.

Deficiency Narrative: No services, accomplishments, or assessments were included in discharge paperwork
Correction Narrative: The form reviewed was completed, and new guidelines were entered into a new form for the operation to complete each time a child is discharged.  This will be in effect moving forward.  See document library.

Deficiency Narrative: No background information or progress notes were given to the worker at discharged (or no documentation of it.
Correction Narrative: The form reviewed was completed, and new guidelines were entered into a new form for the operation to complete each time a child is discharged.  This will be in effect moving forward.  See document library.

Deficiency Narrative: The fire extinguishers need to be serviced annually.
Correction Narrative: On this date, pictures of all fire extinguishers were sent in, as the fire Marshall was able to service all the overdue extinguishers.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's medication record was missing pill counts for three days. Counts need to be entered within 2 hours after administration.
Correction Narrative: A training with all staff on the afternoon of this Monitoring inspection was conducted with a thorough review on medication counts, that all blanks on the for need to be filled out entirely, etc. Bullet points are in document library.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed three over the counter medication logs lacked the time the medicine was administered.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided proof that the medication log was updated to more clearly express the intent that date and time both be recorded, and staff received training with regards to this expectation. This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that three of the four employee files reviewed lacked documentation showing the date of employment for the individual.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided pictures demonstrating that the dates of employment were added to existing files.  They have added a start date field to the front page of their employee records to record this information for future hires.   This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I witnessed a child in care holding an applicator of over-the-counter medication she spilled on her blanket with no caregiver within auditory or visual range of the child.
Correction Narrative: During the walkthrough, I witnessed a child in care holding an applicator of over-the-counter medication she spilled on her blanket with no caregiver within auditory or visual range of the child.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed two of four employee files showed TB test completed outside the 30 day window from date of employment or starting to volunteer at the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation offered a written plan stating that the hiring/training process now requires proof of TB test being provided within the first two weeks of the process.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The administrator's license expired on 12/14/23, and his renewal packet was submitted on 12/16/23, bringing the standard back into compliance on that date.
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed me on 12/16/23 indicating that the renewal packet had been submitted.  This was verified with the appropriate licensing representative.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that one of the four employee records reviewed lacked a copy of the employees' proof of educational level or equivalency.
Correction Narrative: On 11/20/23, the operation provided photographic proof of obtaining the missing educational record and noted that the document would be entered into the employee's file today.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that one of the records reviewed did not have record of the Child's rights form in the file.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an emailed copy of the located Child's Right's form in question and included it in the child's file.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that three of the four records reviewed did not have allergy information clearly identified in the file or on the outside of the record.
Correction Narrative: During the exit, the operation indicated that they would be updating their files to place the data sheet containing allergy information on the outside of the files.  On 10/24/23, the operation provided a picture of the updated allergy sheets now attached to the outside of the file. This picture is located in Document Library.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed cleaning chemicals and lice treatments stored in an unlocked cabinet in the kitchen, accessible to children. The operation relocated these chemicals to a secured location.
During the walkthrough, I observed that the med log for the only child taking prescription medications did not record the name of the prescribing doctor nor the reason for the prescription.
Correction Narrative: On 10/24/23, the operation sent photographs of the corrected medication log that now includes the reason for prescription and the prescribing doctor.  This picture has been uploaded to Document Library.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the administrator was not present and does maintain daily supervision and oversight of the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation issued the following statement regarding this standard via email: Please note that in regard to the administrator responsibility standard, we will be requesting an administrative review. Dr. Steward will continue with administrative oversight; his oversight includes days and overnights and weekends as we are a 24-hour facility so is his supervision. I staffed this with my supervisor, and was advised to accept this statement as compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, the operation identified three individuals that ceased to be controlling persons on 10/17/23 that were not reported to licensing within the timeframe.
Correction Narrative: On 10/24/23, the operation emailed the RCCR representative notifying licensing that they removed the identified individuals from the controlling persons list.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In review of the operation records, I observed that the administrator for the operation is also the administrator for another non-contiguous General Residential Operation in another region.
Correction Narrative: On8/25/23, the administrator provided a copy of the email sent to his RCCR rep for the second GRO over which he was the administrator notifying them that he was no longer the administrator of that operation effective 8/21/23 and identifying the new administrator.  This results in the administrator only being the LCCA at this single operation and brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that three of the fire extinguishers in the operation have not been inspected or serviced by a fire marshall or qualified entity within the past twelve months.
Correction Narrative: On 7/31/23, the operation provided photographic proof of the fire extinguishers in the operation having been serviced in July of 2023.  This brings this standard into compliance.  This follow-up method is labeled email to reflect the digital transmission method and copies of the photos are available in digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed three bedrooms that lacked curtains over the windows allowing shade for rest.
Correction Narrative: On 4/28/23, the operation provided photos via text showing the properly installed curtains in the bedrooms that adequately provide privacy and shade for rest.  This follow-up method is being shown as email to reflect the digital transmission method.  These corrections bring this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that one of four employee files lacked proof of Tuberculosis screening completed within 30 days of initiating employment.
Correction Narrative: On 4/28/23, the operation provided a copy of the TB test missing from the employee file via text message.  The follow-up method for this standard is shown as email to reflect the digital transmission method.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the volunteer policies do not specify the training requirements for volunteers.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including clarification on the training expectations for volunteers.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the floor plan provided identifies rooms marked as bedrooms, but does not specify where caregivers and children will be sleeping respectively.
Correction Narrative: On 2/9/23, the operation emailed me a copy of the updated floor plan clearly identifying which rooms are intended to be resident rooms versus caregiver quarters.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the EBI policies do not list specific techniques approved for use by caregivers and the general descriptions do not match what was identified on the application.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the personnel policies do not contain policies specifying the training requirements for employees and caregivers.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the policies do not specify the individuals outside of the operation with access to records.
Correction Narrative: On 2/21/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the protective surface fill to be at least two inches below the nine inch measuring mark on the equipment.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, photos verifying that additional loose fill has been added to the playground area beneath the playground equipment, and the level reaches the 9 inch demarcation points on all of the equipment.  The follow-up method is being shown as email due to the digital conveyance of the documentation.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the background check policies do not specify the types of background checks applicable to the various positions employed by the facility.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including clarification of background check expectations with specific reference to the required types of background checks applicable.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed the frequency of reports to parents is not specified.  The policy mentions regular reports but does not specify frequency.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including a statement that these reports will be provided at least monthly.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the visitation rights policies do not include policies for visitation between the children and friends.  Dating is covered, but visitation with friends is absent.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including additions pertaining to friend visitation and the parameters for those visits.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was observed that a refrigerator in the kitchen lacked a thermometer.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, photos of the thermometers in all refrigerator units in the facility.  The follow-up method is being shown as email due to the digital conveyance of the documentation.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed the lack of a policy specifying which records must be in external paper files and those that can be stored electronically.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the admission policies do not specify whether the operation accepts emergency placements.  The document states they will accept placement as needs arise for children.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including an explicit statement that the operation will accept emergency placements.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed a lack of policies specifying the Emergency Behavior Intervention training requirements, the curriculum that will be utilized, the amount and type of training required, training content, and how the training will be delivered.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed the lack of a policy specifying plans for protection of paper or electronic records from destruction or loss.
Correction Narrative: On 2/21/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the discipline policies do not detail how Trauma Informed Care is integrated into the care of the children.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed the lack of a policy limiting access to the operation's files to persons within the operation authorized to access and see specific information in an electronic file.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed the lack of a policy pertaining computer security systems addressing confidentiality, password protection parameters, and network access.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that two of the four personnel files reviewed lacked drug testing results in accordance with the operation's policies.
Correction Narrative: On 2/10/23, the operation texted me images of the clear drug tests for the two files cited missing at the inspection.  The follow up method is shown as email to account for the digital transmission of the information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the EBI policies list a number of EBI procedures that do not match the EBI procedures listed on the application.  The EBI description is not specific to the EBI system used.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the lack of a policy addressing the requirements for routine back-up of data.
Correction Narrative: On 2/21/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the policies do not include an orientation discussion with the child regarding the Emergency Behavior Intervention policies required in 748.113(5)(A)(i-ix).
Correction Narrative: On 2/21/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the EBI policies do not include a prohibition against retaliating against an individual for filing a complaint, grievance, or providing good-faith information regarding the misuse of emergency behavior intervention on behalf of another individual.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the EBI policies state that only qualified caregivers can administer EBI, but the policy does not specify the training requirements or criteria by which a caregiver is deemed qualified.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the EBI policies lack a prohibition against retaliation toward an individual for filing a complaint, presenting a grievance, or otherwise providing information about the misuse of emergency behavior interventions at the operation.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the first aide kits reviewed contained several expired medications or supplies.
Correction Narrative: On 2/10/23, the operation provided images of the expiration dates within the first aid kits via text and these were in date.  She reported that the expired first aid kits thrown away.  The follow up method is listed as email to account for the digital, point to point, conveyance of the images.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed the window in the kitchen that would be used to ventilate in case of smoke not having a screen.
Correction Narrative: On 2/10/23, the operation provided, via email, photos of the window with a proper screen installed. The follow up method is listed as email to account for the digital, point to point, conveyance of the images.   This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the documentation, I observed the lack of a policy addressing anti-virus protection systems.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the organizational chart does not label and specify the supervisory relationships between each tier of employee.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including a clarified flow-chart specifying the supervisory relationship of the positions at the facility.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the policies do not specify the individuals within the operation with access to records.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including this information.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed a lack of policies specifying the posting of EBI practices where they can be viewed by children and adults or policies related to providing the clients with copies of the operation's emergency behavior intervention policies.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including a statement that EBI information will be posted.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the policies and procedures, I observed that the admission policies state they will admit without regard to sex; however, the operation is only applying to provide services for girls.  The policies and procedures include parameters for Primary Medical Needs children, but the operation is not applying to provide such services.  The admission policies do not state that they do not take Primary Medical Needs or emotional disturbance.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, an updated policy manual including specific clarification that the operation will only serve girls under the current parameters.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed two of the four personnel records lacking current job descriptions.
Correction Narrative: On 2/10/23, the operation emailed me current job descriptions for the two personnel records lacking them during the inspection.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the first aid kits lacked scissors, adhesive tape, and thermometers.
Correction Narrative: On 2/10/23, the operation emailed photos of the first aid kits containing the missing contents.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was observed that four of the four personnel records reviewed lacked documentation of proof of education level for the employee.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, copies of the proof of education for each of the personnel files reviewed.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that three of the four employee files reviewed lacked proof of TB test.
Correction Narrative: On 2/15/23, the operation provided, via email, a copy of the negative TB tests for the reviewed files.  This brings this standard into compliance.
